Nerangs.ab: ... auuaŋ́he barsom az māhrōy ul stānišn az zōtgāh gām-e pad kust ī frabardārān nihišn mat̰ vā̊ padāiš bē kunišn pad ruwān ō ī bun ī ātaxš gāh tā haiϑiiāuuarəštąm. gōwišn mat̰ vā̊ gām-ē frāz nihišn namāz ō ī zōhr barišn padāiš gām-ē namāz ō zōhr barišn yā frasrūtā īžaiiā̊ gām-ē frāz nihišn be ō ī gāh ābardān šawišn pairi.jasāi šaš gōwišn u-š sē gām az kustag ī hōy pad sar ī barsom bē āyišn

"He has to take the barsom from the māhrōy and make one step towards the side of the frabardārān. Here, he has to recite the section going from mat̰ vā̊ padāiš until haiϑiiāuuarəštąm with the mind put on the beginning of the fire place. At mat̰ vā̊, he has to make a second step and bring homage to the zōhr. At padāiš, one further step and he should bring homage to the zōhr. At yā frasrūtā īžaiiā̊, he has make one step further and to go to the place of the ābardān. He has to recite six times pari.jasāi (?) and he has to make three steps from the left side (of the zōtgāh), (starting) at the (standard) position of the upper end of the barsom."

barsom ul stānišn be gāh ī frabardārān šawišn mat̰. vā̊. bē kunišn pad ruwān ō ī bun ī ātaxš gāh tā haiϑiiāuuarəštąm. gōwišn mat̰ vā̊ gām-ē frāz nihišn namāz ō zōhr barišn padāiš yā̊ gām-ē frasrūtā īžaiiā̊ gām-ē frāz nihišn be ō ī gāh ī abardān pairi.jasāi šaš gōwišn u-š sē gām az kustag ī hōy pad sar ī barsom bē āyišn čē paydāg kū ka andar zōt gāh bē gōwēd ēzišn dēwēzagīh nē pēš ud nē pas ī gām ka-z abēr kučak ēč šāyēd

"He has to take the barsom and go to the place of the frabardārān. He has to begin the recitation of mat̰ vā̊ and recite until haiϑiiāuuarəštąm with his mind put towards the fire. At mat̰ vā̊, he has to make a stept and bring namāz to the zōhr. At padāiš yā̊, one further step. At frasrūtā īžaiiā̊, he has to make a step towards the place of the abardān. He has to recite the six times pari.jasāi (?) and he has to make three steps on the left side (of the zōtgāh) (starting) at the (standard) position of the upper end of the barsom, since it is declared that, when he recites (these stanzas) in the zōtgāh, the liturgy is dēw-worship. Not a step before or a step later. Even if it is a small (step), it is not valid."
barsom az māhrōy ul stānišn mat̰ vā̊ gām-ē abar kunišn padāiš yā̊ gām-ē abar kunišn frasrūtā īžaiiā̊ gām-ē abar kunišn pairi.jasāi. ...

"He has to take the barsom from the māhrōy. At mat̰ vā̊, he has to take an step. At padāiš yā̊, he has to take an step. At frasrūtā īžaiiā̊, he has to take an step (and continue with) pairi.jasāi. ..."

ab.em: abar čim ī gām sē az zōtgāh abastāg gōwišnīh frāz āmad ī zōt pas az yašt pad ātaxš sar pad franābišn ō āb zōhr-barišnīh ul uzīdan ī amahrspandān hamē hanjaman ī hampursagīh ī zardušt sar pad 3 gām az zamīg ō xwaršēd-pāyag pad humad ud hūxt ud huwaršt

Nerangs.ab: About the reason why the zōt goes three steps away from the zōtgāh while saying the Avestan text after the end of the yašt for the fire and the introduction to the offering of zōhr to the water ; (the reason) is the moving of the Amahrspandān after the end of each meeting of Zardušt (with them) through three steps, from the earth to the sun station through humad, hūxt and huwaršt

Quotations.ab: tā ō ī ẏāiš azāθā mahmāi x́iiātā auuaŋᵛhē mat̰ vā̊ padāiš ẏā frasrūtā īzaiiā̊ pairi.jasāi šaš gōwišn u-š sē gām az kust ī hōy pad sar ī barsom be āyišn

"He has to recite the six (stanzas) including ẏāiš azāθā mahmāi x́iiātā auuaŋᵛhē mat̰ vā̊ padāiš ẏā frasrūtā īzaiiā̊ pairi.jasāi and he has to advance three stpes on the left side, (starting) at the (standard) position of the upper end of the barsom."
